page.title: 05FARMING IN CHIPPING WARDEN
page.content: Farming around Chipping Warden is mostly arable, beef, sheep and some dairy. Most of the family farms have been amalgamated into big farms because farmers have retired or sold their farms. The arable consists of wheat,oil seed rape, barley, oats and various grasses grown for seed or feed. Also potatoes and, growing more popular, peas and beans, grown for animal feed. Most of the leys are temporary (one year) with the exception of Mr Goffe and Gibbons which are permanent leys or pasture(over 2 years) Most of the farms employ local staff. With the various farms there are still quite a lot of "tied cottages," houses which belong to the farms. by Michelle Taylor aged 8
